review: I only rate these things on the initial setup and then how easy it is for my kids (4,8,12) to use daily.  Because of course, I don't like to be bothered by complexity and nagging maintenace.  To start, we own all three of the streaming devices, but the kids love this one the best. The other two, Chromecast and Apple TV, each have their flaws.Chromecast might be useful if it was easier to setup, had a seperate remote, and had more processing power.  The kids never used it after it was setup because it required another device to control it and was kind of lost with the other simpler options available.  I eventually gave is away to my brother who is a tech junkie.Apple TV is better, but at twice the price.  I do like this one, though.  You can stream any content from your iPhone or iPad to the TV which the kids love.  The one negative which prevents me from buying another is it doesn't have the Amazon Prime app or a wide selection of other apps.  If I am going to pay for Amamon Prime, then the streaming device better have it installed.  The only plus for Apple TV at this point is its exclusive HBO Now app it enjoys for another 6 months or so.  Of course I like this because we don't subscribe to HBO through our cable provider.Either way, I hope this saves someone some time.

review: It's pretty easy to use because it is just a stick. I did note that when I plugged the power source into the USB port on my TV, it complained that there was not enough power. It did the same when I plugged it into an electrical outlet, so perhaps the USB port might have been usable. That said, the stick is always on so I don't have to power it up. It's far faster than other methods I've used to access Amazon Prime and Netflix. The interface is pretty decent, but you can't blame the stick for how other companies programmed their applications. The remote control is okay. It was challenging to open the back in order to insert the batteries. I also forget that the main "enter" button is the center of a thumb wheel so perhaps labeling it in some way such as "OK" would help. There is not a "stop" button on the remote, either, which takes some getting used to. Lastly, the remote is not labeled at all, so an outsider to your home might not realize it is the remote control associated with the Fire stick.

review: Fire TV stick was easy and quick to set up. Works great for watching Amazon videos, but when I use it to watch Netflix the picture was freezing up, then would fast-forward until the picture and sound synced up again. I took advantage of the Sling TV offer and got the Fire stick for free, the Sling TV App seemed to work okay but is a little sluggish. After using it for a week or so I realized that cutting cable years ago was not just about the money, but also not wanting to spend so much of my free time watching commercials. Now, back to my problem with Netflix freezing up... I decide to use the Factory Reset option found in the Settings Menu. After going through the Setup again, I re-installed Netflix and amazingly it ran flawlessly. I watched over two hours of video without a single freeze or jitter. Then I re-installed Sling TV and my Netflix problem was BACK. So I un-installed Sling TV, problem fixed. Will not renew Sling TV when the 90 days are up... bye bye commercials. Another reason for only giving it 3 stars is, NO Vudu App.
